title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0024

segments.en: Hello, everyone.
Welcome back to another great lesson with us here at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎回到EnglishPod的另一堂精彩课程。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
And I'm Erika.
And today we're going out to eat.
Yes, good thing too, because I'm hungry.
segments.cn: 是的，太好了，因为我饿了。

segments.en: I know, it's almost lunchtime.
segments.cn: 我知道，快到午餐时间了。

segments.en: Yeah.
So today we're going to be talking about eating at a restaurant and giving some great recommendations and suggestions.
segments.cn: 所以今天我们要谈论在餐厅用餐，并给出一些很好的推荐和建议。

segments.en: Yes, we have language for describing food, for describing restaurants, and for making suggestions.
segments.cn: 是的，我们有描述食物、餐厅和提出建议的语言。

segments.en: Great.
So let's start with our vocabulary preview for this lesson.
segments.cn: 那么让我们开始今天课程的词汇预览。

segments.en: Vocabulary Preview We have two words today from our dialogue, which you'll need to know to understand the dialogue.
segments.cn: 词汇预览 我们今天有两个词来自我们的对话，你需要知道这些词以理解对话。

segments.en: Great.
The first one that we have today is food poisoning.
Food poisoning.
Food poisoning.
Food poisoning.
So food poisoning is...
Not a good thing.
Not a good thing.
It is when you eat some bad food and that food makes you sick.
segments.cn: 是你吃了坏食物，导致你生病。

segments.en: So you get food poisoning.
Okay, so food poisoning.
Yeah, not a good thing.
Okay, the next word.
Allergic.
Allergic.
Allergic.
Allergic.
So when you're allergic to something...
segments.cn: 所以当你对某样东西过敏时...

segments.en: It makes you sick.
That one thing makes you sick.
segments.cn: 那样的东西会让你生病。

segments.en: Right.
For example, I'm allergic to seafood.
Right.
If I eat seafood, I cannot breathe.
segments.cn: 如果我吃海鲜，我就无法呼吸。

segments.en: Okay, so you definitely want to stay away from fish.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你绝对要远离鱼。

segments.en: Yes.
Some people are allergic to nuts, like peanuts.
segments.cn: 有些人对坚果过敏，比如花生。

segments.en: Or maybe milk.
Milk.
Yep.
Cool.
So when one type of food makes you sick, you are allergic to that food.
segments.cn: 所以当一种食物让你生病时，你对那种食物过敏。

segments.en: Okay, great.
So with this in mind, now we can listen to our dialogue for the first time at its normal speed.
segments.cn: 记住这一点，现在我们可以第一次以正常速度听我们的对话。

segments.en: But don't worry if you don't get everything now because... We'll come back and teach you the important language.
segments.cn: 但如果你现在没有听懂也没关系，因为... 我们会回来教你重要的语言。

segments.en: Do you two have any plans for the evening?
segments.cn: 你们两个晚上有什么计划吗？

segments.en: We were thinking of checking out a restaurant in the neighborhood.
segments.cn: 我们在想去附近的一家餐厅。

segments.en: Do you have any suggestions?
I know this really nice Italian place.
segments.cn: 我知道一家很不错的意大利餐厅。

segments.en: The food is fantastic, and the decor is beautiful.
segments.cn: 食物非常棒，装饰也很美。

segments.en: I'd recommend giving it a try.
Actually, I'm not all that crazy about Italian food.
segments.cn: 其实，我对意大利食物不是很感兴趣。

segments.en: I'm in the mood for something a bit lighter.
In that case, I know a great little bistro.
segments.cn: 那么，我知道一家很棒的小酒馆。

segments.en: They make a really tasty seafood platter.
segments.cn: 他们做的海鲜拼盘非常美味。

segments.en: The fish is outstanding.
It sounds fantastic, but I'm allergic to seafood, so... Okay, well, let me think.
segments.cn: 听起来很棒，但我对海鲜过敏，所以... 好吧，让我想想。

segments.en: Oh, I know this great little place.
segments.cn: 哦，我知道一家很不错的小店。

segments.en: It's just a hole in the wall, but they do the most amazing sandwiches.
segments.cn: 它只是一个小地方，但他们做的三明治非常惊人。

segments.en: You've got to give them a try.
Ella, you took me there last time I visited, and I got food poisoning, remember?
segments.cn: Ella，上次我来你带我去那里，我得了食物中毒，记得吗？

segments.en: Well, I'm getting hungry just thinking about all of those great restaurants.
segments.cn: 好吧，我光是想起那些很棒的餐厅就饿了。

segments.en: Yeah, some really good recommendations, except for food poisoning, right?
segments.cn: 是啊，真的很好的推荐，除了食物中毒，对吧？

segments.en: No, not so good.
Let's start with our language takeaway for this lesson.
segments.cn: 让我们开始今天课程的语言要点。

segments.en: Language takeaway Our first word on language takeaway is check out.
segments.cn: 语言要点 我们今天的第一个词是check out。

segments.en: Check out.
Check out.
Check out.
So we have some great examples on how we can use check out in different situations, and then you can understand the meaning.
segments.cn: 所以我们有一些很好的例子，展示如何在不同情况下使用check out，然后你可以理解其含义。

segments.en: Example one.
Have you been to the new cafe next door?
segments.cn: 你去过隔壁的新咖啡馆吗？

segments.en: Yeah, I checked it out yesterday.
The food was great.
Example two.
Hey, check out my new car.
Example three.
I'm going to check out the new shopping mall this weekend.
segments.cn: 我这个周末要去看看新的购物中心。

segments.en: So I can understand that it just means look at.
segments.cn: 所以我可以理解它的意思就是看。

segments.en: Yeah, look at.
Or yeah, or go see.
So let's go check out that new bar in town.
segments.cn: 所以我们去看看镇上那家新酒吧吧。

segments.en: Yeah, okay, cool.
Next word is bistro.
So what's a bistro?
It's kind of complicated, but it's like a small restaurant that's not really cheap though.
segments.cn: 这有点复杂，但它像是一个小餐厅，但不是真的便宜。

segments.en: Not so cheap, but not so expensive.
And it's usually French.
Yes, so yeah, small informal restaurant.
segments.cn: 是的，所以是一个小型非正式餐厅。

segments.en: Okay, so our third phrase for today is not all that crazy about.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们今天的第三个短语是not all that crazy about。

segments.en: Not all that crazy about.
I'm not all that crazy about.
Okay, again, kind of a funny phrase, but we've got some examples that will help you understand the meaning.
segments.cn: 好的，再次，这个短语有点有趣，但我们有一些例子可以帮助你理解其含义。

segments.en: Example one.
Do you want to go shopping with me tomorrow?
segments.cn: 你明天想和我去购物吗？

segments.en: I'm not all that crazy about shopping.
segments.cn: 我对购物不是很感兴趣。

segments.en: I don't like spending money.
Example two.
I'm not crazy about jazz music.
Can I change the song?
Okay.
So this is just a really polite way of saying you don't like something.
segments.cn: 所以这只是一个非常礼貌的说法，表示你不喜欢某样东西。

segments.en: Exactly.
But now the opposite of this would be tasty.
segments.cn: 但现在与此相反的词是美味。

segments.en: Tasty.
That's our fourth word, tasty.
segments.cn: 这是我们的第四个词，美味。

segments.en: Tasty.
So when something is tasty.
segments.cn: 所以当某样东西美味时。

segments.en: It's good.
It's good.
Like delicious.
Delicious.
Yeah, you know what, in English we almost never say the food is delicious, but we always say it's really tasty.
segments.cn: 是的，你知道吗，在英语中我们几乎从不说食物美味，但我们总是说它真的很美味。

segments.en: Yes.
This is really tasty.
Yes, okay.
Tasty.
And our last phrase for language takeaway, in the mood for.
segments.cn: 我们最后一个短语是“想要”。

segments.en: In the mood for.
In the mood for.
Let's listen to some examples of this phrase, and we'll understand the meaning a little bit better.
segments.cn: 让我们听一些这个短语的例子，这样我们会更好地理解其含义。

segments.en: Example one.
We always eat hamburgers for dinner.
I'm in the mood for something different.
Example two.
Let's watch a movie.
How about Texas Chainsaw Massacre?
I am not in the mood for a horror movie.
So if I'm in the mood for something, I feel like doing or eating or watching.
segments.cn: 所以如果我想要某样东西，我就想做、吃或看。

segments.en: Yeah, it means you want to do that now.
segments.cn: 是的，这意味着你现在想做那件事。

segments.en: Yeah, I'm in the mood for.
Okay, some great language we just looked at, and I think it's time for us to listen to the dialogue a second time.
segments.cn: 好的，我们刚刚看了一些很棒的语言，我想是时候再听一遍对话了。

segments.en: Do you two have any plans for the evening?
segments.cn: 你们今晚有什么计划吗？

segments.en: We were thinking of checking out a restaurant in the neighborhood.
segments.cn: 我们在考虑去附近的一家餐厅。

segments.en: Do you have any suggestions?
I know this really nice Italian place.
segments.cn: 我知道一家很不错的意大利餐厅。

segments.en: The food is fantastic, and the decor is beautiful.
segments.cn: 食物非常棒，装饰也很美。

segments.en: I'd recommend giving it a try.
Actually, I'm not all that crazy about Italian food.
segments.cn: 其实，我对意大利食物没什么兴趣。

segments.en: I'm in the mood for something a bit lighter.
In that case, I know a great little bistro.
segments.cn: 那么，我知道一家很棒的小酒馆。

segments.en: They make a really tasty seafood platter.
segments.cn: 他们做的海鲜拼盘非常美味。

segments.en: The fish is outstanding.
It sounds fantastic, but I'm allergic to seafood, so...
segments.cn: 听起来很棒，但我对海鲜过敏，所以...

segments.en: Okay, well, let me think.
Oh, I know this great little place.
segments.cn: 哦，我知道一家很棒的小店。

segments.en: It's just a hole in the wall, but they do the most amazing sandwiches.
segments.cn: 它只是一个小地方，但他们做的三明治非常惊人。

segments.en: You've got to give them a try.
Ella, you took me there last time I visited, and I got food poisoning, remember?
segments.cn: 艾拉，上次我去你带我去的地方，我得了食物中毒，记得吗？

segments.en: Okay, some really great and useful phrases there.
segments.cn: 好的，那些真的是很棒和有用的短语。

segments.en: And I know you want to talk about specifically some of these phrases.
segments.cn: 我知道你想特别谈谈这些短语。

segments.en: Yes, today's lesson is all about making recommendations, right?
segments.cn: 是的，今天的课程就是关于推荐的，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
So let's look at some useful phrases in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 所以让我们看看流利构建器中的一些有用短语。

segments.en: Fluency Builder So in the dialogue, we heard a great way of asking for a suggestion.
segments.cn: 流利构建器 在对话中，我们听到了一个很好的询问建议的方式。

segments.en: That's right.
Let's listen.
Do you have any suggestions?
Do you have any suggestions?
So that's how you would ask for a suggestion.
segments.cn: 所以这就是你询问建议的方式。

segments.en: Or you can say something else like, do you have any ideas?
segments.cn: 或者你可以说其他的，比如，你有什么想法吗？

segments.en: Yeah, or you might say, do you have any thoughts?
segments.cn: 是的，或者你可以说，你有什么看法吗？

segments.en: Okay, so that's asking for suggestions.
In response to this, you can say something like this.
segments.cn: 对于这个，你可以这样回答。

segments.en: I'd recommend giving it a try.
I'd recommend giving it a try.
We also heard another phrase that we use for giving suggestions.
segments.cn: 我们还听到了另一个用于给建议的短语。

segments.en: You've got to give them a try.
You've got to give them a try.
So these two phrases are great.
segments.cn: 所以这两个短语都很好。

segments.en: I'd recommend or you gotta give them a try.
segments.cn: 我推荐或者你一定要去试试。

segments.en: Yeah.
Great ways of suggesting.
Yes.
Now, what's really important here is the pronunciation of these words, right?
segments.cn: 现在，这里真正重要的是这些词的发音，对吧？

segments.en: You'll notice that we don't say, I would recommend.
segments.cn: 你会注意到我们不说，我会推荐。

segments.en: Right.
We use the contraction, I'd.
I'd.
I'd.
I'd recommend.
I'd recommend.
Similarly, in the phrase, you have got to, we shorten that to say, you gotta.
segments.cn: 同样，在短语“你必须”的情况下，我们缩短为“你得”。

segments.en: You gotta.
You gotta give them a try.
You gotta.
You know what, guys?
If you can shorten your phrases like this, if you can push the sounds together, you'll sound a lot more natural, hey?
segments.cn: 如果你能像这样缩短你的短语，如果你能把声音连在一起，你会听起来更自然，对吧？

segments.en: And also you'll be able to understand because in movies or in shows, they will never say, you have got to give them a try.
segments.cn: 而且你也能理解，因为在电影或节目中，他们绝不会说，你必须去试试。

segments.en: So if you know how to use this form, you'll understand what they mean.
segments.cn: 所以如果你知道如何使用这种形式，你就能理解他们的意思。

segments.en: Exactly.
Okay, great.
Well, why don't we listen to the dialogue a third time and you'll hear some of these contractions in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 那么，我们为什么不再听一次对话，你会听到一些缩略词。

segments.en: Do you two have any plans for the evening?
segments.cn: 你们俩今晚有什么计划吗？

segments.en: We were thinking of checking out a restaurant in the neighborhood.
segments.cn: 我们在考虑去附近的一家餐厅。

segments.en: Do you have any suggestions?
I know this really nice Italian place.
segments.cn: 我知道一家很不错的意大利餐厅。

segments.en: The food is fantastic and the decor is beautiful.
segments.cn: 食物非常棒，装饰也很美。

segments.en: I'd recommend giving it a try.
Actually, I'm not all that crazy about Italian food.
segments.cn: 其实，我对意大利食物不是很感兴趣。

segments.en: I'm in the mood for something a bit lighter.
In that case, I know a great little bistro.
segments.cn: 那么，我知道一家很棒的小酒馆。

segments.en: They make a really tasty seafood platter.
segments.cn: 他们做的海鲜拼盘非常美味。

segments.en: The fish is outstanding.
It sounds fantastic, but I'm allergic to seafood, so... Okay, well, let me think.
segments.cn: 听起来很棒，但我对海鲜过敏，所以... 好吧，让我想想。

segments.en: Um... Oh, I know this great little place.
segments.cn: 嗯... 哦，我知道一家很不错的地方。

segments.en: It's just a hole in the wall, but they do the most amazing sandwiches.
segments.cn: 只是个小地方，但他们做的三明治非常惊人。

segments.en: You gotta give them a try.
Ella, you took me there last time I visited.
And I got food poisoning, remember?
segments.cn: 我得了食物中毒，记得吗？

segments.en: Okay, great dialogue.
And Erika, I know that you have some food poisoning stories for us.
segments.cn: Erika，我知道你有一些食物中毒的故事要分享。

segments.en: Well, I don't know about stories, but I've definitely had food poisoning before.
segments.cn: 嗯，我不知道有没有故事，但我确实得过食物中毒。

segments.en: One of the worst times that I ever had food poisoning was when I was traveling in Morocco.
segments.cn: 我得食物中毒最严重的一次是在摩洛哥旅行时。

segments.en: Okay.
I had some really amazing orange juice.
segments.cn: 我喝了一些非常美味的橙汁。

segments.en: Really fresh squeezed that day in the morning.
segments.cn: 那天早上刚榨的，非常新鲜。

segments.en: And then I got on a bus.
Okay.
I think you can see where this is going.
segments.cn: 我想你可以猜到接下来发生了什么。

segments.en: Yeah, so I was on the bus and then I started to feel really sick.
segments.cn: 是的，我在公交车上，然后开始感到非常恶心。

segments.en: And I was just hoping and hoping and hoping that the bus ride would be over soon.
segments.cn: 我只是希望公交车的旅程能快点结束。

segments.en: But unfortunately it wasn't.
Oh, no.
All I can say is that I was sick.
All I can say is that I was pretty sick and really, really unhappy.
segments.cn: 我只能说我非常生病，真的非常不开心。

segments.en: Yeah, I bet.
Well, that's very strange that you got sick from orange juice, huh?
segments.cn: 嗯，你因为橙汁生病真是很奇怪，对吧？

segments.en: Well, yeah, maybe it was with some dirty water or something like that.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的，也许是因为用了脏水之类的。

segments.en: I don't know.
It was just... It was a terrible situation.
segments.cn: 这真是... 这是个可怕的情况。

segments.en: Yeah, it's always complicated when you're traveling to other countries.
segments.cn: 是的，旅行到其他国家时总是很复杂。

segments.en: It could be the water.
It could be the way they prepare things.
segments.cn: 也可能是他们的准备方式。

segments.en: Yeah, yeah.
Food poisoning.
Guys, I hope that you don't get food poisoning.
segments.cn: 大家，我希望你们不要得食物中毒。

segments.en: And if you have any food poisoning stories, it would be great for you to share them.
segments.cn: 如果你有任何食物中毒的故事，分享给我们会很棒。

segments.en: Yes, at our website, EnglishPod.com.
And we'll see you there to answer all your questions and comments.
segments.cn: 我们会在那里回答你们的所有问题和评论。

segments.en: But now we have to go.
Okay, guys.
Thanks for listening.
We'll see you there.
Bye.
